total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 5.
Q2: For each row identified in Q1, find the row above it that contains the number 2.
Q3: For each row identified in Q2, find the maximum number of consecutive 2s.
Q4: Create a new grid with the same number of columns as the input grid but only three rows.
Q5: Fill the first and third rows of the new grid with 0s.
Q6: Fill the second row of the new grid with the maximum number of consecutive 2s found in Q3, starting from the fifth column. Fill the rest of the row with 0s.
Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 5.
Q2: For each row identified in Q1, find the row above it that contains the number 2.
Q3: For each row identified in Q2, find the maximum number of consecutive 2s.
Q4: Create a new grid with the same number of columns as the input grid but only three rows.
Q5: Fill the first and third rows of the new grid with 0s.
Q6: In the second row of the new grid, fill the first cells with the number 2, the number of times identified in Q3, starting from the fifth cell.
Q7: Fill the remaining cells in the second row of the new grid with 0s.
Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 5.
Q2: For each identified row in Q1, find the row above it that contains the number 2.
Q3: For each row found in Q2, count the number of 2s.
Q4: Create a new grid with the same number of columns as the input grid.
Q5: For each row found in Q2, add a row to the new grid with the same number of 2s as counted in Q3, starting from the leftmost column.
Q6: For each row added in Q5, add a row above and below it in the new grid with the same number of 3s as the number of 2s in the row, starting from the leftmost column.
Q7: Fill the remaining cells in the new grid with 0s.
select_new_ys: Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 5.
Q2: For each row identified in Q1, find the row above it that contains the number 2.
Q3: For each row identified in Q2, find the maximum number of consecutive 2s.
Q4: Create a new grid with the same number of columns as the input grid but only three rows.
Q5: Fill the first and third rows of the new grid with 0s.
Q6: Fill the second row of the new grid with the maximum number of consecutive 2s found in Q3, starting from the fifth column. Fill the rest of the row with 0s.
